customer_name: The Tropical Rain Forest Preserve Inc
customer_addr:
163 66th Terrace South
West Palm Beach, FL 33413

citations.narrative:
The licensee is approved to have a maximum of 100 animals on hand at any single point in time during the period of
licensure. The animal count at the time of inspection was 124. No more than 100 total animals can be held at the facility
under the current license. Licenses are issued for the number of animals appropriate to a particular facility. Exceeding
those numbers can increase the likelihood of welfare concerns due to the higher population of animals and the associated
maintenance and cleaning requirements. The licensee must reduce the animal population at the facility to 100 or obtain a
new license. Correct by: May 10, 2024

The perimeter fence behind the marmoset enclosures had multiple areas where the fence did not meet the ground. These
deficiencies created openings large enough for animals the size of dogs, skunks, or raccoons to go under the fence and
have contact with the primates. The perimeter fence must be constructed so that it protects nonhuman primates by
restricted unauthorized humans, and animals the size of dogs, skunks, and raccoons from going through it or under it and
having contact with the nonhuman primates. Correct by May 3, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.1(b)(2)(i) 
   
Requirements and application 
The licensee is approved to have a maximum of 100 animals on hand at any single point in time during the period of 
licensure. The animal count at the time of inspection was 124. No more than 100 total animals can be held at the facility 
under the current license. Licenses are issued for the number of animals appropriate to a particular facility. Exceeding 
those numbers can increase the likelihood of welfare concerns due to the higher population of animals and the associated 
maintenance and cleaning requirements. The licensee must reduce the animal population at the facility to 100 or obtain a 
new license. Correct by: May 10, 2024 
3.78(d) 
   
Outdoor housing facilities. 
The perimeter fence behind the marmoset enclosures had multiple areas where the fence did not meet the ground. These 
deficiencies created openings large enough for animals the size of dogs, skunks, or raccoons to go under the fence and 
have contact with the primates. The perimeter fence must be constructed so that it protects nonhuman primates by 
restricted unauthorized humans, and animals the size of dogs, skunks, and raccoons from going through it or under it and 
having contact with the nonhuman primates. Correct by May 3, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
